laws_and_regulations.name: International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR)
laws_and_regulations.description: ITAR controls the export and import of defense-related articles and services on the United States Munitions List (USML).
laws_and_regulations.application: This regulation applies to the scenario as it ensures that the electronic components being purchased from an international supplier do not fall under restricted items that require special export licenses.

laws_and_regulations.name: Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS)
laws_and_regulations.description: RoHS restricts the use of specific hazardous materials found in electrical and electronic products.
laws_and_regulations.application: This regulation is relevant to ensure that the electronic components comply with environmental standards by not containing hazardous substances, which is crucial for environmental compliance.

laws_and_regulations.name: Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act (CPSIA)
laws_and_regulations.description: CPSIA sets safety standards and regulations for consumer products, including electronic devices, to ensure they are safe for use.
laws_and_regulations.application: This law applies to the scenario by ensuring that the electronic components meet safety standards to prevent harm to consumers, thus ensuring product safety compliance.

compliance_checklist.item: Verify that the electronic components do not require an ITAR export license.
Ensure that the electronic components are RoHS compliant and do not contain restricted hazardous substances.
Check that the electronic components meet the safety standards set by CPSIA.
